dspace-development.title: Determine the DataSpace PostgreSQL database host
Restore the previous workflow step for DataSpace Items within the Monographic reports and papers (Access Limited to Princeton) Collection
Diagnose the Symplectic Elements Web of Science (Lite) data source errors
Restore the previous workflow step for DataSpace Items within the Monographic reports and papers (Access Limited to Princeton) Collection

comments.body:
This should be resolved now with the following:

```jruby
eperson = Java::OrgDspaceEperson::EPerson.findByEmail(DSpace.context, user_email)
workflow_items = Java::OrgDspaceWorkflow::WorkflowManager.getPooledTasks(DSpace.context, eperson)
pooled = workflow_items.to_a.map { |wfi| wfi.getItem }
items = pooled.map { |p| DSpace::CLI::Item.new(p) }

query_title = 'National Security Council. Third supplement [microform]'
selected_items = items.select { |i| i.title.include?(query_title) }

selected_items.first.workflow_item.model.getState
selected_items.first.workflow_item.model.setState(3)
selected_items.first.workflow_item.model.update
```

I then verified that this was updated with the following:

```jruby
workflow_items = Java::OrgDspaceWorkflow::WorkflowManager.getPooledTasks(DSpace.context, eperson)
pooled = workflow_items.to_a.map { |wfi| wfi.getItem }
items = pooled.map { |p| DSpace::CLI::Item.new(p) }

selected_items = items.select { |i| i.title.include?(query_title) }
selected_items.first.workflow_item.model.getState
```

I have submitted this to the reporting user for the confirmation that this indeed resolved.

requests.title: Pick-Up Request Emails to Staff Should Include Enum and Chron Information
Add the enumeration for a book to the item display

comments.body:
The dump file with new lines was created by loading the production database locally and then running
```
lando ssh
mysqldump -h database -u drupal7 -p drupal7 --extended-insert=FALSE >dump_newline.sql
exit
```

This files was created by searching the sql dump file with new lines
```
grep http://libweb dump_newline.sql | grep -v revision | grep -v webform_submitted_data  | grep -v linkchecker_link | grep -v field_revision_field_direct_database_link >> libweb.txt
grep http://libweb dump_newline.sql | grep -v revision | grep -v webform_submitted_data  | grep -v linkchecker_link | grep -v field_revision_field_direct_database_link > libweb.txt
awk -F'http' '{print $2}' libweb.txt > libweb_awk.txt
```
Use virtual studio change all to clean up the links and then
```
sort libweb_awk.txt |uniq > libweb_urls_uniq.txt
```
